titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Agnes Elizabeth Brundage diaries ARC.108
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Weatherly Stephan
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-23T10:42-0500

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
This collection combines two accessions: 1973.185 and 1973.186.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Agnes Elizabeth Brundage was born in 1843 in New York City. She married Frank Story Winchester (1841-1884), a New York City lawyer, on October 8, 1866. The couple moved to Brooklyn after their wedding and had three children.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains two diaries, dated 1863 to 1865, as well as five pages of handwritten transcriptions of diary highlights. Also included are calling cards for Agnes Elizabeth Brundage and Mrs. Frank S. Winchester, Brundage's married name. Volume one of the diary covers 1863 to 1864, wherein Brundage discusses living in New York City, the Morrisania neighborhood of the Bronx, and a vacation to Northport, Long Island. Volume two, from 1864 to 1865, discusses vacations on Long Island and visiting a fair, possibly the Brooklyn and Long Island Fair in Aid of the U.S. Sanitary Commission of 1864.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Agnes Elizabeth Brundage diaries, ARC.108, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
